sections.content: Take your Excel skills to the next level with advanced data analysis techniques. Learn how to transform raw data into meaningful insights using PivotTables, advanced functions, and professional reporting tools.
PivotTables are Excel's most powerful data analysis tool, allowing you to summarize, analyze, and present large datasets with ease.

=STDEV(A1:A100)      // Standard deviation
=VAR(A1:A100)        // Variance
=PERCENTILE(A1:A100,0.25)  // 25th percentile
=QUARTILE(A1:A100,1)  // First quartile
=CORREL(A1:A100,B1:B100)  // Correlation coefficient

=VLOOKUP(lookup_value, table_array, col_index, FALSE)
=XLOOKUP(lookup_value, lookup_array, return_array, "Not found")
=INDEX(return_range, MATCH(lookup_value, lookup_range, 0))
=HLOOKUP(lookup_value, table_array, row_index, FALSE)

sections.content: **XLOOKUP** is the modern replacement for VLOOKUP. It's more flexible, handles errors better, and can search in any direction.

data.title: Sales Analysis Dashboard
data.description: Create a comprehensive sales analysis dashboard using PivotTables, advanced functions, and conditional formatting.
steps: Import sales data with multiple columns (Date, Product, Region, Sales, Cost)
Create a PivotTable to summarize sales by region and product
Add calculated fields for profit margin and growth rates
Apply conditional formatting to highlight top performers
Create a combination chart showing sales trends and profit margins
Add data validation to ensure data quality for new entries

rows: Easy to understand at a glance

items: **Start with clean data** - Remove duplicates, fix errors
**Document your analysis** - Include assumptions and methodology
**Use appropriate visualizations** - Match chart type to data
**Validate your findings** - Cross-check with multiple methods
**Keep it simple** - Avoid over-complicating your analysis
**Update regularly** - Maintain current data and insights

sections.content: **Pro Tip**: Always create a backup of your original data before performing complex analysis. Use version control or save multiple copies with different names.

sections.content: **Remember**: Data analysis is both an art and a science. Practice regularly with real data to develop your analytical intuition and technical skills.
